data.title: Cartas de Mujeres. by Benavente, Jacinto: (1932)
data.meta_description: 1st Edition - Hardcover - Libreria Y Casa Editorial Hernando, Madrid - 1932 - Finely bound example of this work from the Nobel Prize-winning dramatist. Duodecimo, bound in full marbled calf with gilt titles and ruling to the spine in six compartments within raised gilt bands, patterned endpapers, engraved headpieces throughout. In very good condition. Jacinto Benavente made his debut as a poet with his 'Cartas de Mujeres' (Women's Letters), after which he ventured into the dramatic and produced 172 more works, most of which are plays. This collection of letters seeks to demonstrate and affirm "la superioridad del talento epistolar" (the superiority of epistolary talent) in women, exploring humanity through social and psychological lenses with beauty and eloquence. - Cartas de Mujeres.
data.text:
About this Item

Finely bound example of this work from the Nobel Prize-winning dramatist. Duodecimo, bound in full marbled calf with gilt titles and ruling to the spine in six compartments within raised gilt bands, patterned endpapers, engraved headpieces throughout. In very good condition. Jacinto Benavente made his debut as a poet with his 'Cartas de Mujeres' (Women's Letters), after which he ventured into the dramatic and produced 172 more works, most of which are plays. This collection of letters seeks to demonstrate and affirm "la superioridad del talento epistolar" (the superiority of epistolary talent) in women, exploring humanity through social and psychological lenses with beauty and eloquence. Seller Inventory # 145262

Contact seller
